abstract: Militants conduct armed assault on Corinthia luxury hotel in Tripoli, Libya, killing at least eight people, at least five of whom were foreign visitors; group Tripoli Province of the Islamic State, which says it is allied with Islamic State group, claims responsibility, and raises prospect that Syrian group's example is worsening violence in Libya.
lead_paragraph: The deadly attack was the most significant in a string of terrorist assaults against Western interests and institutions in Tripoli since the ouster of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi.

byline.contributor: Suliman Ali Zway reported from Tripoli, and David D. Kirkpatrick from Cairo.
byline.original: By SULIMAN ALI ZWAY and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

snippet: The deadly attack was the most significant in a string of terrorist assaults against Western interests and institutions in Tripoli since the ouster of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi.

keywords.value: Tripoli Province of the Islamic State
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

headline.main: Group Linked to ISIS Says It’s Behind Assault on Libyan Hotel
headline.print_headline: Group Linked to ISIS Says It’s Behind Assault on Libyan Hotel
